title: The Fontry's - Greek Set 1 and 2
content:
Let me say that these Greek Sets are not Greek language supported fonts. My apologies. They are Greek symbol fonts (with a complete set of numbers and Roman upper case) for college organizations, fraternities, and sororities for logos, posters, t-shirts, etc.

I've used them for t-shirts mostly...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203015445im_/http:/typophile.com/files/GRKBanner1_3842.jpg)

[Greek 1 available from MyFonts...](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203015445/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry/greek-font-set-1/)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203015445im_/http:/typophile.com/files/GRKBanner_5950.jpg)

[Greek 2 also available from MyFonts...](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203015445/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry/greek-font-set-2/)

Also, you might like to know that more complete versions of each of these fonts are available from the [Fontry](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203015445/http:/new.myfonts.com/foundry/The_Fontry/) or [Fontry West](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203015445/http:/new.myfonts.com/foundry/Fontry_West/) on MyFonts or from [the Fontry website](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203015445/http:/www.thefontry.com/).

Thanks for taking a peek and have a great day....

~~~~~~~~~~~~~

[_...from the Fontry_](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203015445/http:/www.thefontry.com/)
author: phrostbyte64

comments.content: The Greek 2 set will definitely be a boon to sign shops in college towns.
Definitely a smart niche to fill!
